result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Phillip Stehr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 15CF471 for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Case calendared for Projected guilty plea hearing.  Defense counsel requests new date.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-23-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Defendant has pending case in Branch 26.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 26, pending acceptance.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
From Attorney Debra Patterson received and filed.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr not in court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant may be eligible for Drug Treatment Court. Case calendared for STATUS on 4/13/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Case should have been assigned to Judge Watts court.  Clerk contacted Judge Watts clerk.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 3/16/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 15.  aw
Supplemental Order setting Forth Conditions of Defendant's Release, for no drugs, no drug paraphernalia or no weapons, signed and filed.

Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in custody.  Ron Dague for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement  to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Matthew Phillip Stehr in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 1/27/15 @ 8:30am
